intro: Meibomia laevigata, commonly known as the smooth meibomia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, simple leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, dry seeds.
